column4: I'm on an emergency shell, I need help mounting a scsi external usb drive
do I have to create the mountpoint before? when I tried "mount sdb" the reply I got was "can't find sbd in fstab of mtab"
you need to mount a specific partition  (sdb1)  , and yes you need to creat a mount point   sudo mkdir /media/usb    for exemple
what is the FS of that usb drive ? ntfs will cause you problems you won'T be able to write to it
I know, it took me 2 days to manage to format it to fat32
